title: Code Snippets
text:
The example renames .jpg files. Modify as per your need.
ls -v | cat -n | while read n f; do mv -n "$f" "$n.jpg"; done
To start numbering at certain number use the following code
num=0; for i in *; do mv "$i" "$(printf '%04d' $num).${i#*.}"; ((num++)); done
For more on this, look here



Modify as per need
rename 's/\_/-/' *


for file in *' '*
do
  mv -- "$file" "${file// /-}"
done




rename 'y/A-Z/a-z/' *



find . -type f | wc -l



`sed -i 's/$/\n/' file.txt`

### Convert all mp4 to mp3


```{.bash code-line-numbers="true"}
#!/bin/bash
local o=$IFS
IFS=$(echo -en "\n\b")

MP4FILE=$(ls . |grep .mp4)
for filename in $MP4FILE
do
name="${filename%.*}"
ffmpeg -i ./$filename -b:a 192K -vn ./$name.mp3
done

IFS=o

title: Code Snippets
text:
Excel / Google Sheet

Mode for ordinal data
=INDEX(UNIQUE(I2:I107), MATCH(MAX(COUNTIF(I2:I107, UNIQUE(I2:I107))), COUNTIF(I2:I107, UNIQUE(I2:I107)), 0))


Median for ordinal data
=INDEX({"Strongly Disagree","Disagree","Neither Agree nor Disagree","Agree","Strongly Agree"}, MEDIAN(FILTER(MATCH(I1:I106, {"Strongly Disagree","Disagree","Neither Agree nor Disagree","Agree","Strongly Agree"}, 0), ISNUMBER(MATCH(I1:I106, {"Strongly Disagree","Disagree","Neither Agree nor Disagree","Agree","Strongly Agree"}, 0)))))

title: Stat Mania Docs
text:
This websites mainly contains lectures slides and questions on statistics. It also contains some useful code snippets, covering linux command line, git, spreadsheet, among others.
All the lectures are made using R programming language inside Rstudio IDE. The presentations were made using the revealjs package.
Questions are made using \(\LaTeX\) inside Rstudio.

title: Stat Mania Docs
text:
How to Use

Press space or down-arrow (\(\downarrow\)) to go the next slide or see hidden contents.
Press up-arrow (\(\uparrow\)) or P to go the previous slide.
Press right arrow or left arrow to see next/previous chapter

See more here

title: Resources
text: The Great Quiz Book

title: Code Snippets
text:
Git

Repository-specific confiuguration
git config --local user.name 'Your Name'
git config --local user.email 'your.work.email@company.com'


Global confiuguration
`git config --global user.name 'Your Name'`
git config --global user.email 'your.work.email@company.com'

title: Code Snippets
text:
The example renames .jpg files. Modify as per your need.
ls -v | cat -n | while read n f; do mv -n "$f" "$n.jpg"; done
To start numbering at certain number use the following code
num=0; for i in *; do mv "$i" "$(printf '%04d' $num).${i#*.}"; ((num++)); done
For more on this, look here



Modify as per need
rename 's/\_/-/' *


for file in *' '*

  mv -- "$file" "${file// /-}"
done




rename 'y/A-Z/a-z/' *



find . -type f | wc -l



`sed -i 's/$/\n/' file.txt`

### Convert all mp4 to mp3


```{.bash code-line-numbers="true"}
#!/bin/bash
local o=$IFS
IFS=$(echo -en "\n\b")

MP4FILE=$(ls . |grep .mp4)
for filename in $MP4FILE
do
name="${filename%.*}"
ffmpeg -i ./$filename -b:a 192K -vn ./$name.mp3
done

IFS=o

title: Presentation
text:
Integration

\(\int x^3+2x\)
\(\int_2^3 x^2+x\)
Relationship between integration (I) and differentiation(D).


Answer


\(f(x) \to I \to D \to f(x)\)
Test with \(f(x) = x^2\)

title: Presentation
text:
PDF vs PMF Curve


PDF

Continuous


PMF

Discrete

title: Presentation
text:
Integration and Area
  Source: hyperphysics 

Area = Integration = Probability (if [0,1])
\(Area = height \times width = \int f(x) \times dx\)

title: Presentation
text:
PDF and PMF Conditions


PDF
  Source: upgrad.com 

\(0 \le f(x) \le 1\)
\(\displaystyle \int_{-\infty}^\infty f(x)dx = 1\)



PMF











\(0 \le P(X=x) \le 1\)
\(\sum P(x_i) = 1\)
Thus the sum of all possible outcomes is zero

title: Presentation
text:
PDF and PMF Properties


Probability Density Function (continuous)

\(\displaystyle \int_{{\, - \infty }}^{{\,\infty }}{{f\left( x \right)\,dx}} = 1\)
\(P\left( {a \le X \le b} \right) = \int_{{\,a}}^{{\,b}}{{f\left( x \right)\,dx}}\)
\(P(X=x)=0\) (theoretically, why?)



Probability Mass Function (discrete)

\(\displaystyle \sum_{{\, - \infty }}^{{\,\infty }}{{f\left( x \right)\,dx}} = 1\)
\(P_x(X) = P(X=x)\)

title: Presentation
text:
PMF Problem 01
\(\displaystyle P(x) = \frac{x+1}{k}; x= 1,2,3,4\)

k = ?
\(P(X \ge2)\)
\(P(X \le 3)\)
\(P(2 < X \le 5\)

title: Presentation
text:
PMF Problem 02
Given, \(P(x) = \frac{2x+k}{56}; x = -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3\)
Discrete or Continuous?

k = ?
Find probability of each value of x
Find \(P(-2 \le x \le 2)\)

title: Presentation
text:
PMF problem from coin
An unbiased coin is tossed four times and the number of times the heads are obtained is denoted by x. Determine the probability mass function.

\(S = \{HHHH, HHHT, \cdots\}\)
\(x = 0, 1, 2, 3, 4\)
\(P(X = 2) = \frac{4C_2}{2^4}\)
\(P(x) = \frac{4C_X}{2^4}\)

title: Presentation
text:
PDF Problem 01
\(\displaystyle f(x) = kx(x-1); 1\le x \le 5\)

Find k
\(P(X>1)\)
\(P(X \le 3)\)
\(P(2 \le x < 4)\)

title: Presentation
text:
Problems Archive
Look here

title: Presentation
text:
Cumuluative Distribution Function
F(x) or cdf accumulates all of the probability less than or equal to.












x
1
2
3
4
5
6




P (x)
\(\frac 1 7\)
\(\frac 1 7\)
\(\frac 1 2\)
\(\frac 1 7\)
\(\frac 1 7\)
\(\frac 1 7\)


F (x)
\(\frac 1 7\)
\(\frac 2 7\)
\(\frac 4 7\)
\(\frac 5 7\)
\(\frac 6 7\)
\(1\)



Find

\(P(X<4)\)
\(P(3<X<6)\)

title: Presentation
text:
cdf definition
\(F_X(x) = P(X\le x)\)


Discrete
\[F(x) = \sum_{X\le x} P(x)\]


Continuous 

\[F_{X}(x) = \int_{-\infty}^x f_X(t)dt\]
Find cdf for \(f(x) = 2x; 0\le x \le 1\)
\(\int \to x^2\)


Answer


\[\begin{eqnarray}
F(x) =
\begin{cases}
x^2/2,  & 0\le x \le 1 \\
0, & \text{otherwise}
\end{cases}
\end{eqnarray}\]

title: Presentation
text:
cdf properties

\(P(a\le x \le b) = F(b)-F(a)\)for \(a\lt b\); what if \(a \lt x \lt b?\)
For continuous x, \(f(x) = \frac{d}{dx}[F(x)]\)
\(F(-\infty) =0 , F(+\infty) = 1\)

title: Presentation
text:
Joint Probability Function
Let, \(I = Infected\), and \(V = Vaccinated\)




\(I\)
\(\bar I\)
Total




\(V\)
3
276
279


\(\bar V\)
66
473
539


Total
69
749
818



Find the probability that

a vaccinated person is infected
a non-vaccinated person is uninfected


These are joint probabilities \(\to\) P(x,y)
\(P(x,y) =P(x) \cdot P(y)\) if \(x\) and \(y\) are independent.

a vaccinated person is infected
a non-vaccinated person is uninfected
vaccinated if infected

vaccinated
uninfected

title: Presentation
text:
Joint PF Properties

\(P(x,y) \ge 0\)
\(\Sigma\Sigma P(x,y)=1\)

text:

PSC

Marginal: \(P(Pass) = P(x_1)=P(x_1,y_1)+P(x_1,y_2)+P(x_1,y_3)\)
\(P(Absent) = P(x_3) = P(x_3,y_1)+P(x_3,y_2)+P(x_3,y_3)\)

title: Presentation
text:
Marginal Probability
Consider the previous table
Joint probability: \(P(x_i, y_j); i = 1,2, \cdots m; j = 1,2, \cdots n\)
Marginal probability \(\to P(x_i) \leftarrow P(x_i, y_j)\)

For x: \(\displaystyle P(x_i) = \sum_{j=1}^n P(x_i, y_j); i = 1,2, \cdots m\)
For y: \(\displaystyle P(y_i) = \sum_{i=1}^m P(x_i, y_j); j = 1,2, \cdots n\)
What about continuous x?

title: Presentation
text:
Marginal Probability Properties

\(P(x_i) \ge 0\) and \(P(y_i) \ge 0\)
\[\sum_{i=1}^m P(x_i)=\sum_{j=1}^n P(y_j)=1\]

Summing marginal probabilities will give 1.

title: Presentation
text:
Joint-Marginal Example
\(P(x,y) = \frac{x+y}{9}; x=0,1,2; y = 0, 1\)

Find marginal probabilities
Check properties (sum)


\(P(x) = \frac{2x+1}{9}\)

title: Presentation
text:
Conditional Probability Function
Like Bayes Theorem
\(P(X_i|y_j) = \frac{P(x_i,y_j)}{P(y_j)}; P(y_j) \gt 0\)
Properties

\(\sum_{j=1}^m P(x_i|y_j)=\sum_{i=1}^m P(y_j|x_i)=1\)

title: Presentation
text:
Conditional Probability Example
\(P(x,y) = \frac{x+y}{9}; x=0,1,2; y = 0, 1\)
Find \(P(X|Y)\) and \(P(Y|X)\)
Find for continuous X as well.

title: Presentation
text:
Find k for pdf
\(f(x) = kx^2+kx+\frac 1 8; 0 \lt x \lt 2\)

Find k
Find \(P(1 \lt X \lt 2)\)





docs.statmania.info | Abdullah Al Mahmud
